bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, August 19, 1950

div1.p: Hench would like to have a photograph of the plaque placed on the building where Walter Reed died. Hench tells Siler that he has heard from Sidney Wallach again.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, August 19, 1950
div1.opener:
August 19, 1950
Colonel J. F. Siler
Gorgas Memorial Institute
Executive Offices
1835 Eye Street, N.W.
Washington 6, D. C.
My dear Colonel Siler:
div1.p:
I shall be very glad to have a photograph
of the Walter Reed Memorial Tablet in the future,
when it is convenient for you to have one made. I
have had no further letter from Mrs. Griswold.

I have another letter from Mr. Wallach
but he just writes and seems to do nothing. I
have repeatedly asked him to get in touch with
the Walter Reed Memorial Association and I suppose
if necessary, the Association could even hold a
special meeting, but instead he just keeps writing
to me.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
